Ability Score Improvement, Eldritch Versatility( Optional)
As a warlock, you gain the follow class feature.
Hit Dice: 1d8 per warlock level Hit Points at 1st Level: 8+ your Constitution modifier Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8( or 5)+ your Constitution modifier per warlock level after 1st
Armor: Light armor Weapons: Simple weapon Tools: None Saving Throws: Wisdom, Charisma Skills: Choose two from Arcana, Deception, History, Intimidation, Investigation, Nature, and Religion
You start with the follow equipment, in addition to the equipment grant by your background:
( a) a light crossbow and 20 bolt or( b) any simple weapon
( a) a component pouch or( b) an arcane focus
( a) a scholar 's pack or( b) a dungeoneer 's pack
Leather armor, any simple weapon, and two dagger
At 1st level, you have struck a bargain with an otherworldly be of your choice. Your choice grant you feature at 1st level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.
Your arcane research and the magic bestow on you by your patron have give you facility with spell.
You know two cantrips of your choice from the warlock spell list. You learn additional warlock cantrips of your choice at high level, a show in the Cantrips Known column of the Warlock table.

The Warlock table show how many spell slot you have to cast your warlock spell of 1st through 5th level. The table also show what the level of those slot be; all of your spell slot be the same level. To cast one of your warlock spell of 1st level or high, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expend spell slot when you finish a short or long rest.
For example, when you be 5th level, you have two 3rd-level spell slot. To cast the 1st-level spell witch bolt, you must spend one of those slot, and you cast it a a 3rd-level spell.
At 1st level, you know two 1st-level spell of your choice from the warlock spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Warlock table show when you learn more warlock spell of your choice of 1st level or high. A spell you choose must be of a level no high than what 's show in the table 's Slot Level column for your level. When you reach 6th level, for example, you learn a new warlock spell, which can be 1st, 2nd, or 3rd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the warlock spell you know and replace it with another spell from the warlock spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slot.

Charisma be your spellcasting ability for your warlock spell, so you use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when set the save throw DC for a warlock spell you cast and when make an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC= 8+ your proficiency bonus+ your Charisma modifier
Spell attack modifier= your proficiency bonus+ your Charisma modifier
You can use an arcane focus a a spellcasting focus for your warlock spell.
In your study of occult lore, you have unearthed Eldritch Invocations, fragment of forbidden knowledge that imbue you with an abide magical ability.

At 2nd level, you gain two eldritch invocation of your choice. When you gain certain warlock level, you gain additional invocation of your choice, a show in the Invocations Known column of the Warlock table. A level prerequisite refers to your level in this class.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the invocation you know and replace it with another invocation that you could learn at that level.
At 3rd level, your otherworldly patron bestows a gift upon you for your loyal service. You gain one of the follow feature of your choice.

Pact of the Blade You can use your action to create a pact weapon in your empty hand. You can choose the form that this melee weapon take each time you create it. You be proficient with it while you wield it. This weapon count a magical for the purpose of overcome resistance and immunity to nonmagical attack and damage. Your pact weapon disappears if it be more than 5 foot away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the weapon( no action require), or if you die. You can transform one magic weapon into your pact weapon by perform a special ritual while you hold the weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be do during a short rest. You can then dismiss the weapon, shunt it into an extradimensional space, and it appear whenever you create your pact weapon thereafter. You ca n't affect an artifact or a sentient weapon in this way. The weapon cease be your pact weapon if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different weapon, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The weapon appear at your foot if it be in the extradimensional space when the bond break.

You can use your action to create a pact weapon in your empty hand. You can choose the form that this melee weapon take each time you create it. You be proficient with it while you wield it. This weapon count a magical for the purpose of overcome resistance and immunity to nonmagical attack and damage.

Your pact weapon disappears if it be more than 5 foot away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the weapon( no action require), or if you die.
You can transform one magic weapon into your pact weapon by perform a special ritual while you hold the weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be do during a short rest.

You can then dismiss the weapon, shunt it into an extradimensional space, and it appear whenever you create your pact weapon thereafter. You ca n't affect an artifact or a sentient weapon in this way. The weapon cease be your pact weapon if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different weapon, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The weapon appear at your foot if it be in the extradimensional space when the bond break.

Pact of the Chain You learn the find familiar spell and can cast it a a ritual. The spell do n't count against your number of spell know. When you cast the spell, you can choose one of the normal form for your familiar or one of the follow special form: imp, pseudodragon, quasit, or sprite. Additionally, when you take the Attack action, you can forgo one of your own attack to allow your familiar to make one attack with it reaction.
You learn the find familiar spell and can cast it a a ritual. The spell do n't count against your number of spell know.
When you cast the spell, you can choose one of the normal form for your familiar or one of the follow special form: imp, pseudodragon, quasit, or sprite.
Additionally, when you take the Attack action, you can forgo one of your own attack to allow your familiar to make one attack with it reaction.

Pact of the Tome Your patron give you a grimoire call a Book of Shadows. When you gain this feature, choose three cantrips from any class 's spell list( the three need n't be from the same list). While the book be on your person, you can cast those cantrips at will. They do n't count against your number of cantrips know. If they do n't appear on the warlock spell list, they be nonetheless warlock spell for you. If you lose your Book of Shadows, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be perform during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous book. The book turn to ash when you die.

Your patron give you a grimoire call a Book of Shadows. When you gain this feature, choose three cantrips from any class 's spell list( the three need n't be from the same list). While the book be on your person, you can cast those cantrips at will. They do n't count against your number of cantrips know. If they do n't appear on the warlock spell list, they be nonetheless warlock spell for you.

If you lose your Book of Shadows, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be perform during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous book. The book turn to ash when you die.

Pact of the Talisman Your patron give you an amulet, a talisman that can aid the wearer when the need be great. When the wearer fails an ability check, they can add a d4 to the roll, potentially turn the roll into a success. This benefit can be use a number of time equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expend us be restore when you finish a long rest. If you lose the talisman, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be perform during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous amulet. The talisman turn to ash when you die.

Your patron give you an amulet, a talisman that can aid the wearer when the need be great. When the wearer fails an ability check, they can add a d4 to the roll, potentially turn the roll into a success. This benefit can be use a number of time equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expend us be restore when you finish a long rest.

If you lose the talisman, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be perform during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous amulet. The talisman turn to ash when you die.

Pact of the Star Chain( UA) Prerequisite: Seeker Patron The Seeker grant you a chain forge from starlight, decorate with seven gleam mote of brightness. While the chain be on your person, you know the augury spell and can cast it a a ritual. The spell do n't count against your number of spell know. Additionally, you can invoke the Seeker 's power to gain advantage on an Intelligence check while you carry this item. Once you use this ability, you can not use it again until you complete a short or long rest. If you lose your Star Chain, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from the Seeker. The ceremony can be perform during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous chain. The chain disappears in a flash of light when you die. The exact form of this item might be different depend on your patron. The Star Chain be inspire by the Greyhawk deity Celestian.

The Seeker grant you a chain forge from starlight, decorate with seven gleam mote of brightness. While the chain be on your person, you know the augury spell and can cast it a a ritual. The spell do n't count against your number of spell know.

Additionally, you can invoke the Seeker 's power to gain advantage on an Intelligence check while you carry this item. Once you use this ability, you can not use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

If you lose your Star Chain, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from the Seeker. The ceremony can be perform during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous chain. The chain disappears in a flash of light when you die.
The exact form of this item might be different depend on your patron. The Star Chain be inspire by the Greyhawk deity Celestian.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability score of your choice by 1. As normal, you ca n't increase an ability score above 20 use this feature.
Whenever you reach a level in this class that grant the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can do one of the follow, represent a change of focus in your occult study:
Replace one cantrip you learn from this class 's Pact Magic feature with another cantrip from the warlock spell list.
Replace the option you chose for the Pact Boon feature with one of that feature 's other option.
If you 're 12th level or high, replace one spell from your Mystic Arcanum feature with another warlock spell of the same level.
If this change make you ineligible for any of your Eldritch Invocations, you must also replace them now, choose invocation for which you qualify.
At 11th level, your patron bestows upon you a magical secret call an arcanum. Choose one 6th-level spell from the warlock spell list a this arcanum.
You can cast your arcanum spell once without expend a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

At high level, you gain more warlock spell of your choice that can be cast in this way: one 7th-level spell at 13th level, one 8th-level spell at 15th level, and one 9th-level spell at 17th level. You regain all us of your Mystic Arcanum when you finish a long rest.
